questions.question: What is a strong password?
options: A password that includes a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols
A password that is easy to remember, like 'password123'
A password that consists only of numbers
A password that uses your birthdate
questions.correctAnswer: A password that includes a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols

questions.question: Why are weak passwords dangerous?
options: They can be easily guessed or cracked, leading to security breaches
questions.correctAnswer: They can be easily guessed or cracked, leading to security breaches

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a weak password?
Which of these is a common cyber threat?
Why is using the same password for multiple accounts risky?
options: Because it makes logging in faster
Because if one account is breached, all accounts with the same password can be compromised
Because websites require the same password
questions.correctAnswer: Because if one account is breached, all accounts with the same password can be compromised

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a good password practice?
options: Using a password manager to store passwords

questions.question: What should you do if you suspect your password has been compromised?
options: Wait and see if anything happens
Share it with a friend to test if it still works
Keep using it until you are locked out
